description.narrative: Cordaid project managers/officers and CSO/NGO partners of Cordaid working on the nexus

Long-term objective:
Cordaid and the Resilience team are better able to position themselves as an expert on nexus programming, and are able to provide guidance on how to design and implement nexus programmes in the future.
Short-term objective:
To document Cordaid’s track record on nexus programming, the outputs of which can be used for visibility, to guide project development and implementation, and support outreach to and collaboration with other actors on the ground.

The nexus approach is the latest trend in the international aid sector, with the double nexus referring to linking humanitarian aid and sustainable development and the triple nexus also including conflict transformation. Resilience programming at Cordaid bridges these domains by working on the basis of the disaster management cycle, where implemented projects work on both sides of the nexus with long-term development and humanitarian aid. In cases where conflict (risk) comes into play, resilience programming even works on the triple nexus.
This project is specifically intended to document Cordaid’s track record on nexus programming, the outputs of which can be used for improved visibility, to guide project development and implementation, and to support outreach to and collaboration with other actors on the ground. Documenting such a track record follows in line with Cordaid’s multiannual strategy, where we want to position Cordaid as an NGO with a holistic approach, linking multiple sectors, linking relief with recovery and development and addressing conflict risk.
